<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D64640D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	GRAVITY&nbsp;CO.,&nbsp;LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9. Goodwill and other intangible assets&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company performed its annual impairment test for goodwill at its
	reporting unit using data as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015. In performing the valuations, the Company used cash flows, which reflected management&#146;s forecasts and discount rates which reflect the risks associated with the current
	market. Prior to performing the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	two-step
</FONT>
	impairment test for goodwill, the Company performed a qualitative assessment for the reporting unit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In performing the annual impairment test for goodwill for Gravity Games in 2013, the fair value of the business reporting unit
	Gravity Games was determined to be lower than its carrying amount. Therefore, during the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the Company recorded impairment losses of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	2,653&nbsp;million in reporting unit of Gravity Games due
	to the overall decline in the fair value of the reporting unit and uncertainty in the future. The fair value of the reporting unit was estimated principally using the expected present value of the future cash flows. As a result of impairment, the
	goodwill for the reporting unit of Gravity Games Corporation was fully written off as of December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2014,
	the Company concluded not to recognize impairment loss for goodwill as the fair value of the business reporting unit was determined to be greater than its carrying amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2015, the Company recorded impairment losses of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,210 million in the reporting unit NeoCyon as a result of
	the goodwill impairment test. The fair value of the reporting unit was estimated principally using the expected present value of the future cash flows. Due to decline in forecasted performance in our annual goodwill impairment test, the fair value
	of the reporting unit NeoCyon was determined lower than its carrying amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2005, Gravity introduced a defined contribution pension plan (&#147;Pension Plan&#148;) in
	accordance with the Employee Benefit Security Act of Korea and entered into a nonparticipating defined contribution insurance contract with a life insurance company. Gravity&#146;s contribution to the Pension Plan was
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,114&nbsp;million,
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,227&nbsp;million and
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	827 million in 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively. In 2011, NeoCyon,&nbsp;Inc. also introduced a pension plan.
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	467&nbsp;million,
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	569&nbsp;million, and
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	562 million were recognized as a cost for such pension plan in 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively. For the contributions already paid, Gravity and NeoCyon will have no legal or constructive
	obligation to pay further amounts and therefore no severance benefits were accrued. The accrued severance benefits recorded at December&nbsp;31, 2015 relate to the other employees who have not been included in a Pension Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	11. Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company has outstanding licensing agreements for Ragnarok Online with 7
	companies internationally. Based on the agreements with the licensees, the Company receives certain amounts (24% to 40%) of each licensee&#146;s revenues as royalty.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-23
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	GRAVITY&nbsp;CO.,&nbsp;LTD.
</B>
</P>

	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	11. Commitments and Contingencies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In January 2015, the Company entered into a development agreement with
	Shanghai The Dream Network Technology Co., Ltd., or Dream Square, to develop and distribute two mobile games in China based on the contents of Ragnarok Online, which was amended in March 2016 to grant Dream Square an exclusive right to develop
	mobile games and web games based on the contents of Ragnarok Online and distribute such games for 5 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December
	31, 2015, the Company has contracts for the exclusive rights of Ragnarok Online II game distribution and sales with GungHo Online Entertainment, Inc. (&#147;GungHo&#148;) in Japan, PT. Lyto Datarindo Fortuna in Indonesia and Shanghai The Dream
	Square Network Technology Co., Ltd. in China. Among aforementioned contacts, the Board of Directors of the Company has approved a termination of the license and distribution agreement for Ragnarok Online II with GungHo in January 2016 (See
	Note&nbsp;18). The contract with AsiaSoft Corporation CO., Ltd. in Thailand and in Vietnam were terminated in June 2015. Also the Company entered into the contract for the exclusive rights of Dragon Saga game distribution and sales with Electronic
	Extreme in Thailand in October 2015. The contract periods of these license agreements range from one to three years after commercialization in each geographical location.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2013, the license fee the Company has committed to pay upon the commercial launches of the licensed
	games were
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	200&nbsp;million and
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	450&nbsp;million for Steal Fighter and a Web
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	browser-based
</FONT>
	game, respectively. But the agreement for Steal Fighter and a Web
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	browser-based
</FONT>
	game were terminated in January 2014 and June 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The
	Company entered into various capital lease agreements to utilize game servers. The Company made principal and interest payments of $243&nbsp;thousand (
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	256&nbsp;million) and $22&nbsp;thousand (
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	23&nbsp;million) in
	2013 and $137&nbsp;thousand (
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	144&nbsp;million) and $11&nbsp;thousand (
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	11&nbsp;million) in 2014, respectively. In 2015, the Company made principal and interest payments of $103&nbsp;thousand (
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	117
	million) and $4&nbsp;thousand (
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	4&nbsp;million), respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	leases as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, are as follows:

<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D64640D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	GRAVITY&nbsp;CO.,&nbsp;LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	11. Commitments and Contingencies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Litigation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In April 2009, the Company repatriated
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,820&nbsp;million ($1.4&nbsp;million) from Gravity Middle
	East&nbsp;&amp; Africa
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	FZ-LLC
</FONT>
	(&#147;ME&amp;A&#148;), which was the primarily remaining net assets of ME&amp;A. In August 2010, the director and manager of ME&amp;A, as a representative of ME&amp;A, filed a
	lawsuit against the Company and some of its directors and officers on the subject of them being accused of the repatriation of ME&amp;A claiming an aggregate of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,628&nbsp;million (AED 5&nbsp;million and related interest plus
	litigation costs). In November 2011, the case was decided in favor of the plaintiff and the Company filed an appeal with the Seoul High Court and paid a deposit in court amounting to
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	4,140&nbsp;million to proceed with the appeals
	against the dismissal of the case regarding the repatriation of capital funds from ME&amp;A. The court ruled partially in favor of the plaintiff in December 2012. The Company filed a final appeal in December 2012 and the plaintiff filed a final
	appeal in January 2013 with the Supreme Court of Korea with additional deposit in court of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	130 million. In November 2014, the case was closed as a result of the settlement with the plaintiff and the deposit in court amounting
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	4,270 million was fully refunded to the Company. In November 2015, ME&amp;A was liquidated in accordance with the law of United Arab Emirates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In May 2010, former executive filed another lawsuit claiming employment termination without cause, amounting to
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	50&nbsp;million. The case was dismissed and the plaintiff filed an appeal with the Seoul High Court in April 2011. The Court dismissed the plaintiff&#146;s appeal in March 2013 and the plaintiff filed a final appeal with the
	Supreme Court of Korea in April 2013. The Supreme Court of Korea ceased to hear such appeals and ruled such appeals dismissed in July 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Furthermore, in June 2011, the former executive filed another lawsuit against the Company claiming nullity of dismissal and
	seeking remuneration, amounting to
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	110&nbsp;million due regarding the remainder of his term. In June 2012, the case was decided in favor of the Company and the plaintiff filed an appeal with the Seoul High Court. In January 2013
	the appeal was withdrawn by the plaintiff.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	12. Shareholders&#146; Equity
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, Gravity is authorized to issue a total of 40&nbsp;million shares with a par
	value of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	500 per share, in registered form, consisting of common shares and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-voting
</FONT>
	preferred shares. Of this authorized amount, Gravity is authorized to issue up to 2&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-voting
</FONT>
	preferred shares. Under the articles of incorporation, holders of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-voting
</FONT>
	preferred shares are entitled to receive dividends of not less than 1% and up to 15% of
	the par value of such shares, the exact rate to be determined by Gravity&#146;s Board of Directors at the time of issuance, provided that the holders of preferred shares are entitled to receive dividend at a rate not lower than that determined for
	holders of common shares. Gravity does not have any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-voting
</FONT>
	preferred shares outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had a total of 6,948,900 common shares issued and outstanding. All of the issued and
	outstanding shares are fully paid and are registered.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Income taxes recognized directly in other comprehensive income for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 are
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	17 million,
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>

<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-current
</FONT>
	deferred income tax assets
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Deferred income tax assets are recognized only to the extent that realization of the related
	tax benefit is more likely than not. Realization of the future tax benefits related to the deferred income tax assets is dependent on many factors, including the Company&#146;s ability to generate taxable income within the period during which the
	temporary differences reverse, the outlook for the economic environment in which the Company operates, and the overall future industry outlook.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In assessing the realizability of deferred income tax assets, management considered whether it was more likely than not that
	some portion or all of the deferred income tax assets would not be realized. In particular, a significant portion of the available loss carryforwards and tax credit carryforwards is expected to expire if the Company does not generate sufficient
	taxable income in Korea. The ultimate realization of deferred income tax asset is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income during the periods in which those temporary differences became deductible. Management considered the scheduled
	reversal of deferred tax liabilities, uncertainty in the future taxable income, the tax structure of the Company and tax planning strategies in making this assessment. In 2013, based on the level of historical taxable income and the future taxable
	income under the Company&#146;s business plan over the periods in which the deferred tax assets were deductible, management believed it was more likely than
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-27
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage157"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	GRAVITY&nbsp;CO.,&nbsp;LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	14. Income Taxes&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	not that
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	2,642 million or 13% of the deferred tax assets from tax credit carry forwards is realizable for Gravity. However, in 2014 and 2015, management believed it was more
	likely than not that Gravity and certain subsidiaries could not realize the benefits of these deductible differences, available loss carryforwards and tax credit carryforwards, and recognized full allowances from deferred income tax assets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, Gravity Co., Ltd. in Korea had temporary differences of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	12,465 million, available
	loss carryforwards of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	32,471 million, foreign tax credit carryforwards and tax credit carryforwards for research and human resource development etc. of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	9,156 million and
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,801 million,
	respectively, which expire from 2016 to 2020. Based on the Company&#146;s historical and projected net and taxable income, the Company determined that it would not be able to realize these temporary differences, available loss carryforwards and tax
	credits carryforwards, and recognized a valuation allowance of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	20,843 million on the full amount of temporary differences, available loss carryforwards and available tax credit carryforwards at an effective rate expected to be
	incurred to Gravity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, NeoCyon, Inc., the Company&#146;s 96.11% owned subsidiary in Korea, had
	temporary differences of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	332 million and available loss carryforwards of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	4,839 million. Also, the subsidiary had foreign tax credit carryforwards and tax credit carryforwards for research and human resource
	development etc. of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	744 million and
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,643 million, respectively, which expire from 2016 to 2020. Based on this subsidiary&#146;s historical and projected net and taxable income, the Company determined that it
	would not be able to realize these temporary differences, available loss carryforwards and tax credits carryforwards, and recognized a valuation allowance of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	3,525 million on the full amount of the temporary differences, available
	loss carryforwards and tax credits carryforwards at an effective rate expected to be incurred in Korea.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31,
	2015, Gravity Entertainment Corp., the Company&#146;s 100% owned subsidiary in Japan, had temporary differences of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	245 million and available loss carryforwards of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	79 million which expire from 2016 to 2022. Based
	on this subsidiary&#146;s historical and projected net and taxable income, the Company determined that it would not be able to realize these temporary differences and loss carryforwards, and recognized a valuation allowance of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	136
	million on the full amount of the temporary differences and available loss carryforwards at an effective rate expected to be incurred in Japan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, Gravity Interactive, Inc., the Company&#146;s 100% owned subsidiary in US, had available loss
	carryforwards of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	8,648 million for federal tax and
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	9,043 million for state tax, respectively, which expire from 2027 to 2035. Based on this subsidiary&#146;s historical and projected net and taxable income, the
	Company determined that it would not be able to realize these loss carryforwards, and recognized a valuation allowance of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	3,735 million on the full amount of the available loss carryforwards at an effective rate expected to be
	incurred in U.S.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, Gravity Games Corporation, the Company&#146;s 85.50% owned subsidiary in Korea,
	had temporary differences of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	1,797 million and available loss carryforwards of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	9,892 million. Also, the subsidiary had foreign tax credit carryforwards and tax credit carryforwards for research and human resource
	development etc. of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	178 million and
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	158 million, respectively, which expire from 2016 to 2020. Based on this subsidiary&#146;s historical and projected net and taxable income, the Company determined that it would
	not be able to realize these temporary differences, available loss carryforwards and tax credits carryforwards, and recognized a valuation allowance of
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	2,907 million on the full amount of the temporary differences, available loss
	carryforwards and tax credits carryforwards at an effective rate expected to be incurred in Korea.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	GRAVITY&nbsp;CO.,&nbsp;LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	14. Income Taxes&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Korean statutory tax rate applicable to the Company for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 is 22%. Deferred taxes are measured using the enacted tax rate expected to apply at the time of reversal, which is 22% for the Company. On January 1, 2014, amended local income tax law was enacted. This
	amendment has an impact on calculation of surtax on income tax for the period ended December 31, 2014 and 2015. Prior to the amended local income tax law was enacted, surtax on corporate income tax was calculated at 10% of income tax payable which
	was subtracted by tax credit. However, it is now calculated at 10% of income tax payable in accordance with this amendment. Such change resulted in change in the tax rate for calculation of deferred tax asset of tax credit carryforward to 20% from
	22%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A reconciliation of income tax expense (benefit) from the Korean statutory income tax rate to actual income tax
	expense is as follows:
</P>

	&nbsp;

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company assessed uncertain tax positions and measured unrecognized tax benefits for open
	tax years in accordance with ASC 740, Income Taxes. The Company&#146;s policy is that it recognizes interest expenses and penalties related to income tax matters as a component of income tax expense. Accordingly, the Company assesses its income tax
	positions and records tax benefits for all years subject to examinations based upon the evaluation of the facts, circumstances and information available at that reporting date. For those tax positions for which it is more likely than not that a tax
	benefit will be sustained, the Company records the amount that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon settlement with a taxing authority that has full knowledge of all relevant information. If the Company does not believe that it
	is more likely than not that a tax benefit will be sustained, no tax benefit is recognized.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Based on the approach above,
	the Company assessed the uncertain tax positions and did not record any unrecognized tax benefits as the Company believes that it is more likely than not that there will not be any unrecognized tax benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-29
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(*)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	The valuation allowances decreased primarily due to the expiration of unused foreign tax credits and unused
	net operating loss carryforwards.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	15. Operating Segments and Geographic Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Operating segments of the Company are consistent with its internal organizational structure, the manner in
	which its operations are reviewed and managed by its Chief Executive Officer, who is its Chief Operating Decision Maker (&#147;CODM&#148;), the manner in which the Company assesses operating performance and allocate resources, and the availability
	of separate financial information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company had previously reported its results of operations under one operating
	segment. In 2015, the Company realigned new operating segments comprised of online game operations and mobile game operations. During the fiscal year of 2015, our CODM decided to begin to receive and analyze separate financial information of the
	operating segments in order to perform independent evaluations about its online game operations and mobile game operations and to make separate business decisions and, also to allocate resources for each segment. The nature of change is based on
	consideration about (i) recent focus on mobile game business due to significant growth of global mobile game market as well as (ii) gradually declining portion of online game revenues in total revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The CODM does not review any information regarding total assets on an operating segment basis, and accordingly, no disclosure
	is made with respect thereto. Information on the operating segments and reconciliations of total net revenues and total segment operating income to consolidated net revenues from external customers and consolidated operating income for the years
	ended December 31, 2013, 2014, and 2015 are presented in the table below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On April&nbsp;1, 2008, GungHo Online Entertainment,&nbsp;Inc. became a majority shareholder by
	acquiring 52.39% of the voting shares from Heartis&nbsp;Inc., the former majority shareholder, and acquired additional 6.92% voting shares on June&nbsp;23 and June&nbsp;24, 2008. The transactions with GungHo and the related balances during 2013,
	2014 and 2015 were included in related party transactions above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Due to the disposal of equity investments in Gravity EU
	SAS, in November 2014, the related party relationships between the Company and the equity investees was discontinued. Therefore, the transactions with Gravity EU SAS that occurred before the disposal of the equity investments was included in the
	related party transactions. Sales to Gravity EU SAS were
<STRIKE>
	W
</STRIKE>
	237 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-31
</P>

<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	16. Related Party Transactions&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Zerodiv Inc. has been excluded from the coverage of GungHo Online
	Entertainment,&nbsp;Inc.&#146;s consolidation as a result of the sale of all of its shares at December 1, 2015. Therefore, the related party relationship between the Company and Zerodiv Inc. was discontinued and the transactions with Zerodiv Inc.
	that occurred before the sales date was included in the related party transactions.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	18. Subsequent events
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Directors of the Company has approved a termination of the license and distribution agreement
	for Ragnarok Online II with GungHo Online Entertainment Inc. (&#147;GungHo&#148;). Gravity and GungHo entered into the license and distribution agreement on September 29, 2006, which granted GungHo the exclusive right to service Ragnarok Online II
	in Japan. However, Ragnarok Online II has not yet been launched in Japan and has had limited success in certain jurisdictions where the game has been launched. Therefore, in relation to Ragnarok Online II in Japan, after discussions with GungHo and
	due consideration, Board of Directors of the Company unanimously approved the termination of the license agreement with GungHo. In February 2016, the agreement was terminated and as part of the termination, $5,000 thousand in initial payments
	received from GungHo, which were recorded as long-term deferred revenue as of December 31, 2015, will be refunded in four equal payments by the end of the December 2017. This termination has no impact on the Company&#146;s financial operation for
	the year ended December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-32
</P>
</EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
</EFX_FORM>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FOURTH AMENDMENT TO
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	THE
	EXCLUSIVE RAGNAROK ONLINE LICENSE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	AND DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	THIS FOURTH AMENDMENT (&#147;this Amendment&#148;) is made and entered into on this
<U>
	5
</U>
<U>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
</U>
<U>
	day
</U>
<U>
	of
</U>
<U>
	March
</U>
<U>
	, 2
</U>
<U>
	01
</U>
<U>
	5
</U>
	(&#147;Effective Date&#148;), by and between
<B>
	Gravity Co., Ltd.,
</B>
	(&#147;
<B>
	Licensor
</B>
	&#148;), a corporation
	duly organized and existing under the laws of the Republic of Korea and having its principal office at 15F, Nuritkum Square R&amp;D Tower, 396, Worldcup buk-ro, Mapo-Gu, Seoul, Korea and
<B>
	AsiaSoft
</B>
<B>
	Corporation
</B>

	Public
</B>

	Co.,
	Ltd.,
</B>
	(&#147;
<B>
	Licensee
</B>
	&#148;) a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of the Thailand and having its principal office at 9 U.M. Tower, 28
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	Floor, Room 9/283-5,
	Ramkhamhaeng Road, Suanluang, Bangkok 10250, Thailand.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>
	RECITALS
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	WHEREAS
</B>
	, Licensor and Licensee (&#147;Parties&#148; collectively) signed EXCLUSIVE RAGNAROK ONLINE LICENSE AND DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT
	(&#147;the Agreement&#148;), on 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of March 2010; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	WHEREAS,
</B>
	Parties
	entered into FIRST AMENDMENT TO RAGNAROK LICENSE AND DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT (&#147;the First Amendment&#148;), on 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of March 2010.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	WHEREAS
</B>
	, Parties entered into SECOND AMENDMENT TO THE EXCLUSIVE RAGNAROK ONLINE LICENSE AND DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT (&#147;the Second
	Amendment&#148;), on 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of March 2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	WHEREAS
</B>
	, Parties entered into
	THIRD AMENDMENT TO THE EXCLUSIVE RAGNAROK ONLINE LICENSE AND DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT (&#147;the Third Amendment&#148;), on 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of March 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	WHEREAS
</B>
	, this Amendment is supplemental to the Agreement, and the Parties enter into this Amendment, to amend certain provisions in the
	Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	NOW, THEREFORE,
</B>
	in consideration of the mutual promise and covenants contained herein, the Parties agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
<B>
	Renewal Term
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Parties agree to extend the term of the Agreement for one (1) year (&#147;Renewed Term&#148;) from March 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	, 2015 with conditions stated below in this Amendment. The Newly extended term of the Agreement shall be from March 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	, 2015 to March 4
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	, 2016.
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>

<B>
	Renewal Condition
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	(1) License Fee.
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Licensee shall pay to
	Licensor a non-recoupable and non-refundable Renewal License Fee in the amount of Twenty-five Thousand USD (US$25,000) within Thirty (30) Calendar days of the Effective Date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Except as expressly set forth herein, this Amendment shall not by implication or otherwise alter, modify, amend or in any way affect any of the
	terms, conditions obligations, covenants or agreements contained in the Agreement amended by its amendments, all of which are ratified and affirmed in all respects and shall continue in full force and effect.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 4.56
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TO
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ONLINE GAME LICENSE
	AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	This SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT TO ONLINE GAME LICENSE AGREEMENT ( the
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Agreement&#148;
</I>
</B>
	) is made and entered
	into on this 18
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of August, 2015 (the
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Effective Date&#148;
</I>
</B>
	) by and between:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Gravity Co. Ltd., a corporation duly organized and validly existing under the laws of the Republic of Korea
	(
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Korea
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
	) and having its principal place of business at R&amp;D Tower 15F, Nuritkum Square, 396 Worldcup Buk-ro, Mapo-Gu, Seoul, Korea
	(
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Gravity
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
	); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Shanghai The Dream Network Technology Co., Ltd. (in
	Chinese&#147;
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/20/0001193125-16-547162_G64640G89F03.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/20/0001193125-16-547162_G64640G62B19.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
	&#148;), a corporation duly organized and validly existing under the laws of the People&#146;s Republic of China (
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	China
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
	) and having its principal place of business at
	2F Building B, No. 2453 Wanhangdu Road, Changning District, Shanghai, China (&#147;Dream Square&#148;);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Gravity and Dream
	Square shall be referred to collectively as the &#147;Parties&#148; and individually as a &#147;Party&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	RECITALS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	WHEREAS,
</B>
	The Parties entered into the ONLINE GAME LICENSE AGREEMENT on 15
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of
	January, 2015 (
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Original Agreement&#148;
</I>
</B>
	) to distribute a localized version of Ragnarok online 2 for use in in China;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	WHEREAS,
</B>
	the Parties hereby desire to alter&nbsp;the&nbsp;way&nbsp;of cooperation.
<B>
</B>
	Dream Square desires to develop the Game (as
	defined hereinafter) based on Ragnarok online 2 and to distribute the Game in China
<B>
</B>
	instead of distributing
<B>
</B>
	and operating
<B>
</B>
	the localized version of Ragnarok online 2 in China. Gravity desires to grant to Dream Square the
	aforementioned right and to alter the license in Original Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	NOW, THEREFORE
</B>
	, in consideration of the mutual promises and
	covenants contained herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the Parties hereto agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 1: DEFINITIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the purpose of clarification, the terms defined in the Original Agreement shall have the meaning only under the Original
	Agreement, and shall not be used in this Agreement unless the terms redefined hereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The terms defined in this Article shall have the
	meaning ascribed to them herein whenever they are used in this Agreement, unless otherwise clearly indicated by the context.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	1
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage165"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Affiliate(s)&#148;
</I>
</B>
	with respect to a corporation, partnership or other
	entity, shall mean each such other corporation, partnership or other entity that directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with, such corporation, partnership or other entity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Agreement&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall have the meanings set forth in the introductory section of this agreement, and all annexes,
	amendments and supplements hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&#147;
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Business Day
</I>
</B>
<B>
	&#148;
</B>
<B>
</B>
	shall be any day of the week other than a
	Saturday, Sunday or a legal holiday upon which banks in Korea and China are open for business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Close Beta
	Test
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	shall mean the secured and non-public testing of the beta version of the Game by a select group of the End Users prior to the Open Beta Test, which is to be performed by Dream Square or its sub-licensee
	in the Territory.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Confidential Information&#148;
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	shall mean all materials, know-how, software or other similar
	types of information including proprietary information and materials regarding a Party&#146;s technology, products, business information or objectives, including the software for the Game and Technical Information as defined in this Agreement, as
	well as all information which is designated as confidential in writing by the providing Party or which is the type that is customarily considered to be confidential information by persons engaged in similar activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Commercial Launch&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean the Game is commercially launched by Dream Square or Sub-licensee and start charging
	from the End Users directly or indirectly in the Territory. and &#147;
<B>
	Commercial Launch Date
</B>
	&#148; means the exact date of the Commercial Launch of the Game in the Territory.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Content
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	means the name of the Game, storylines, characters, names, symbols,
	titles, logos, artwork, music and sound, game concept, designs, visual representations and likenesses, worlds, and universe of the Game.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Distribution Cost&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean all fees paid to payment gateways and/or the amount of discounts provided to thirty
	party distributors other than Sub-licensee from the face value in connection with their payment collection and distribution services relating to the Game, and the authorized cost and/or fees deducted from the Gross Revenue by authorized distributors
	other than Sub-licensee in accordance with applicable license and distribution agreements
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;End Users&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean
	individual users of the Game, located in the Territory, who are offered or provided access to the Game through a game service system established and operated by Dream Square or Sub-licensee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage166"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Game&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean the Simplified Chinese language version of a massively
	multiplayer online role-playing game for use on personal computers operating on the Microsoft Windows Operating System(
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	MMORPG
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	) developed by Dream Square based on the Original Game (together with its Updates)
	and the Licensed Property, which has a client for End User to download it on personal computers and access the Game and shall further be defined as including any modified or advanced version of the Game developed by Dream Square for error
	correcting, updating, or debugging purpose, under the same title. Any subtitled version, series or Sequel to the Game, or other language version of the Game, or other type or genre of the Game including but not limited to mobile game, arcade game,
	video game, social network game, and other genre of online game than MMORPG which may be developed or distributed by Gravity shall be clearly excluded from the scope of the Game. Dream Square may use &#147;Ragnarok&#148; or &#147;
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/20/0001193125-16-547162_G64640G54K08.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
	&#148; as the name or the part of the name of the Game, provided that the name of the Game shall be agreed between the Parties, and the use of such name shall be distinguished from the name of other licensee&#146;s games
	using &#147;Ragnarok&#148; or &#147;
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/20/0001193125-16-547162_G64640G14U34.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
	&#148; as the name or the part of the name of game under the license agreement with Gravity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&#147;
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Game Services
</I>
</B>
<B>
	&#148;
</B>
	shall mean underlying and supporting game services (including, but not limited, to web
	portals, customer support, billing, quality assurance, technical support, live operations, network operations, online customer relations, account support, and other personnel and/or elements) necessary to permit End Users to enjoy the Game.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Gross Revenues&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(1) in case of servicing the Game to End Users by Dream Square, total revenue arising from or related to selling, distributing, operating and
	providing the Game and/or service, or other business activities related to the Game and/or service within the Territory including but not limited the sale of game points that are purchased or recharged, whether online or offline by means of prepaid
	card purchase, online payment or otherwise, by End Users. However, the amount refunded to End User and any other revenue of the Game that was recognized by Dream Square but has not been actually collected shall not be included in the Gross Revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(2) in case of servicing the Game to End Users by Sub-licensee, the license fees, minimum guaranteed royalties, royalties and any other
	amount that Dream Square receives from such Sub-Licensee in consideration of licensing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Intellectual
	Property&#148;
</I>
</B>
<I>
	or
</I>
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Intellectual Property Rights&#148;
</I>
</B>
<I>
</I>
	shall mean all patents, designs, utility models, copyrights, know-how, trade secrets, trademarks, service mark, trade dress and any other intellectual
	property rights, whether registered or not.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Licensed Property&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	all the content, elements, components, Technical information and Intellectual Property of the Original Game and any other game of the game
	series under the &#147;Ragnarok&#148; trademark, including, without limitation, source code, any artworks, music and sound, logos, trademarks and other marks, words, scripts, titles, compositions and lyrics of the music, characters, storyboards,
	storylines, game concept, designs, models, videos, visual representations and likeness, the promotion materials (except for the source code of the Korean language version of the prequel of the Original Game(&#147;
<B>
<I>
	RO1
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) ).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage167"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&#147;
</B>
<B>
<I>
	MG (Minimum Guarantee)
</I>
</B>
<B>
	&#148;
</B>
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	shall mean the
	minimum royalty paid by the Dream Square to Gravity. &#147;MG&#148; shall be paid to the Gravity at the time specified in 5.2, and deducted from the royalty that will be paid by Dream Square.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Net Revenue
</I>
</B>
	&#148; shall mean:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	in case of servicing the Game to End Users by Dream Square, the applicable Gross Revenue less the Distribution
	Cost in the Territory.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	in case of servicing the Game to End Users by Sub-licensee, Gross Revenue.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Open Beta Test&#148;
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	shall mean the secured testing of the beta version of the Game by offering the Game to the
	general public for trial for a limited period of time prior to the Commercial Launch Date of the Game, which is to be performed by Dream Square or other distributors authorized by Dream Square in the Territory.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Original Game&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean the Korean language version of massively multiplayer online role-playing
	game(
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<I>
<U>
	MMORPG
</U>
</I>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	) known as &#147;Ragnarok online 2&#148; and shall further be defined as including any modified or advanced version of the Original Game distributed by Gravity for error correcting, updating or
	debugging purpose, under the same title. Any subtitled version, series or Sequel to the Original Game, or other language version of the Original Game, or other type or genre of the Original Game including but not limited to mobile game, arcade game,
	video game, social network game, and other genre of online game than MMORPG which may be developed or distributed by Gravity shall be clearly excluded from the scope of the Original Game.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Parties
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
<I>
	and
</I>
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Party
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	shall mean
<I>
	Gravity
</I>
	and Dream Square collectively and individually, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Publishing Rights&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean the rights to do the following;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	To provide the Game Services to End Users;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	To generate, promote, market, and use the Game, and in connection therewith, copy and use the textual, sound
	and/or graphical content pertaining to the Game, including the characters, stories and sound recordings, on marketing collateral;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	To install, copy (object code only) and use the Game for the purpose of operating, maintaining, and
	distributing the Game;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	To sublicense any third party to publish, operate, market, use the Game on its platform.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage168"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Sequel&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean any new MMORPG game based on the Game or the Original
	Game that (i) reflects a substantially different gameplay than the Game or the Original Game, (ii) does not interoperate with the existing the Game or the Original Game, (iii) is capable of being played as a MMORPG game separate and apart from the
	Game or the Original Game, and (iv) is commercially launched as a separate MMORPG game apart from the the Game or the Original Game.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Sublicensing&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean a license granting a portion or all of the rights, to a third party
	(
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Sub-licensee&#148;
</I>
</B>
	) by Dream Square, which has been granted to Dream Square under this Agreement. When used as a verb, &#147;Sublicense&#148; means to engage in Sublicensing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Technical information
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean the software including, without limitation, source code
	of the Game and/or the Original Game, know-how, data, test result, layouts, artwork, processes, scripts, concepts and other technical information on or in relation to the Game and/or the Original, and the installation, operation, maintenance,
	service and use thereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;Territory&#148;
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	shall mean Mainland China.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Update
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
</B>
	shall mean software updates, enhancements, patches, improvements or updates to
	the Game.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 2: GRANT OF LICENSE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Gravity hereby grants to Dream Square, and Dream Square hereby accepts from Gravity, under the terms and
	conditions set forth in this Agreement, an exclusive license and right (a) to use the Licensed Property to develop, promote and market the Game for the service of the Game in the Territory; and (b) to market, host, operate, publish, distribute and
	grant End Users in the Territory access to the Game during the Term; and(c) to sublicense all or part of the Publishing Rights for the service of the Game in the Territory. If Gravity or Dream Square wishes to publish the Game out of the Territory,
	the Parties shall negotiate in good faith and reach an amendment to this Agreement, and a written publishing agreement out of the Territory should be signed among the Parties and the distributor. For avoidance of doubt, any provision of this
	Agreement shall not preclude or restrict Gravity&#146;s rights to develop, operate, distribute, market, use or license (i) any and all kinds of games based on the Original Game for territories other than the Territory and/or (ii) any other genre or
	kinds of game different from the Game for the service of games in the Territory.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the Term,
	Gravity shall not develop or license others to develop, distribute or operate, directly or indirectly, any other massively multiplayer role-playing online game (except for the web-browser game without client and the Prequel or Sequel of the Original
	Game) based on any part of the Game for the service in the Territory.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage169"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Within the Territory, Dream Square may publish, market, operate, and make the Game available to authorized End
	Users within the Territory through an authorized Sub-licensee provided that Dream Square shall be able to enter Sub-licensing agreement with Sub-licensee after receipt of prior written approval from Gravity regarding such license agreement.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	The Licensed Property shall be delivered to Dream Square by Gravity through secured FTP together with Email
	for use in accordance with the terms hereunder within 15 days after receiving a requiring list of the Licensed Property from Dream Square.&nbsp;Furthermore, Gravity shall provide the Licensed Property in time according to the requests of Dream
	Square during the development and distribution process.&nbsp;The Licensed Property will be used on an exclusive basis in accordance with Article 2.1, in the development, operation, distribution, and marketing of the Game by means of, including
	without limitation, reproduction, alteration, translation, modification, displaying, being embodied into the Game or marketing materials.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	During the Term of this Agreement, in the event that Dream Square desires to use the Licensed Property to
	develop Sequel of the Game, Dream Square has the right of first refusal to get an license from Gravity to develop such Sequel on an non-exclusive basis and service such developed Sequel on an exclusive basis in the Territory.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Gravity hereby agrees that the trademarks registered or applied by Gravity or other Intellectual Property
	Rights in connection with the Licensed Property may be used in the marketing of the Game and be used to produce and sell derivative products by Dream Square and its authorized Sub-licensee, provided that Gravity&#146;s prior written permission shall
	be needed in case of (1) using Intellectual Property Rights of the Licensed Property other than the Original Game or (2) using Intellectual Property Rights of the Licensed Property for selling such derivative products. For clarification, the
	trademarks registered or applied by Gravity may be used by Dream Square and its authorized Sub-licensee on a non-exclusive basis.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	During the Term, Gravity shall not (and shall not permit, grant, or license any third party the right to)
	market, promote, copy, display, use, distribute, publish, operate, and sell the Game.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Dream Square has the right to develop collateral materials and assets to be used in connection with the
	marketing, commercial release and distribution of the Game in the Territory
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 3: DEVELOPMENT LOCALIZATION AND
	OPERATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Dream Square shall develop the Game: including its updates at its own costs and responsibility: including
	concept, design, gameplay ideas, QA, and gameplay testing, and shall provide ongoing contents and support after Commercial Launch.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	6

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Dream Square shall start the Commercial Launch of the Game within 18 months after the Effective
	Date.&nbsp;Dream Square is entitled to outsource some or all of the non-core development work of the Game, including without limitation artwork.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	3.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Dream Square or its authorized Sub-licensee shall perform the following functions in the Territory, using such
	standard practices, methods and techniques:
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.3.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Dream Square or its authorized Sub-licensee shall be responsible for the marketing, promotion and distribution
	of the Game and related Game Services within the Territory, and may submit the Game to the third party platform operators.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.3.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Dream Square or its authorized Sub-licensee shall provide game support (including without limitation online
	in-game support), offline phone support, and email support to End Users within the Territory.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.3.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
	Dream Square or its authorized Sub-licensee shall be responsible for billing, collection and support
	requirements of the Game Services, including, without limitation, operating and maintaining a secure billing system to establish new End User accounts, authenticate user names/passwords, and maintain billing records.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:12PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
